intro: Schizoglossum linifolium var. linifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf schizoglossum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
